Package com.google.mu.util.stream

Class FluentLookup<K,​V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.mu.util.stream.FluentLookup<K,​V>
  • public final class FluentLookup<K,​V>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class aims to simplify the common "lookup-then-filter" boilerplate in stream chains: 
    
 Map<K, V> map = ...;
 collection.stream()
     .map(map::get)
     .filter(v -> v != null)
     ...;

    Using FluentLookup, it can be simplified to: 

    
 Map<K, V> map = ...;
 collection.stream()
     .flatMap(FluentLookup.in(map)::findOrEmpty)
     ...;

    When used in a Collector: 

    
 ImmutableMap<K, V> map = ...;
 return Collectors.flatMapping(FluentLookup.in(map)::findOrEmpty, downstream);

    In a slightly different variant, you may need to call a function to get the lookup key, and then need to retain both the original element and the looked-up result. This can be done by storing the result pair in a BiStream. For example: 

    
 Map<StudentId, Score> testResults = ...;
 BiStream<Student, Score> studentsWithScore = BiStream.concat(
     students.stream().map(FluentLookup.in(testResults).matchByOrEmpty(Student::id)));
    Or, it can be composed with BiStream.concatenating(java.util.function.Function<? super T, ? extends com.google.mu.util.stream.BiStream<? extends K, ? extends V>>) to make syntax more fluent: 
    
 import static com.google.mu.util.stream.BiStream.concatenating;

 Map<StudentId, Score> testResults = ...;
 BiStream<Student, Score> studentsWithScore =
     students.stream()
         .collect(concatenating(FluentLookup.in(testResults).matchByOrEmpty(Student::id)));
    Since:
    4.7

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.stream.Stream<V> findOrEmpty​(K key)
      Looks up the backing map for key and returns a singleton stream with the value, or empty stream if not found.
      static <K,​V>
      FluentLookup<K,​V>      		 in​(java.util.Map<K,​V> map)
      Returns an instance backed by map.
      <T> java.util.function.Function<T,​BiStream<T,​V>> matchByOrEmpty​(java.util.function.Function<? super T,​? extends K> keyFunction)
      Returns a function that for any given input, applies keyFunction and then looks up the value mapped to the key from the backing Map.
      BiStream<K,​V> matchOrEmpty​(K key)
      Looks up the backing map for key and returns a singleton BiStream with the key and the matching value, or empty stream if not found.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • in

        public static <K,​V> FluentLookup<K,​V> in​(java.util.Map<K,​V> map)
        Returns an instance backed by map. The returned instance can then be passed to flatMap() for a stream.

      • matchByOrEmpty

        public final <T> java.util.function.Function<T,​BiStream<T,​V>> matchByOrEmpty​(java.util.function.Function<? super T,​? extends K> keyFunction)
        Returns a function that for any given input, applies keyFunction and then looks up the value mapped to the key from the backing Map. If a value is found, the pair of (input, looked-up-value) is returned; otherwise empty.

        Can be composed with BiStream.concat(Stream) or BiStream#concatenating() to create BiStreams: 

        
 Map<StudentId, Score> testResults = ...;
 BiStream<Student, Score> studentsWithScore = BiStream.concat(
     students.stream().map(FluentLookup.in(testResults).matchByOrEmpty(Student::id)));

      • matchOrEmpty

        public final BiStream<K,​V> matchOrEmpty​(K key)
        Looks up the backing map for key and returns a singleton BiStream with the key and the matching value, or empty stream if not found. Useful as a method reference passed to BiStream.concat(Stream) or BiStream#concatenating().

      • findOrEmpty

        public final java.util.stream.Stream<V> findOrEmpty​(K key)
        Looks up the backing map for key and returns a singleton stream with the value, or empty stream if not found. Useful as a method reference passed to stream.flatMap().
